May is MENTAL HEALTH AWARENESS MONTH. We need to nurture and protect our mental health and WELL-BEING now, more than ever. If you’re concerned about a Beverly student, please let us know! Normanonymous is a confidential Website for BHHS students and parents. The goal of this site is NOT to get people in trouble but to provide SUPPORT to them through the NormanAid Wellness Center. To make a report, visit Normanonymous.org

If YOU want to talk to a counselor, please sign up for an APPOINTMENT using normanaidrequest.org. Our counselors are available Monday through Friday, 8 am to 3 pm.
For additional social-emotional and WELLNESS resources, visit normanaid.org. Follow @bhhsnormanaid for more information! 🧡🧡🧡

Congratulations to the team led by Mr. Frenn and our National Winners: Daniel Salkin, Doris Gong, and Sarah Zhang, and Top Scorers: Luke Barber, Nayoung Kim, Benjamin Maman, Natalie Moon, and Lucas Eskildsen-Lee. Additionally, two Bulldogs became Award Winners at the LA County Science & Engineering Fair! Congratulations to 6th grader Yaroslav Kutepov on the James E. Roberts Award from “Professional Engineers in California Government” & 7th grader Tali Goldkorn on the Cheryl Saban Self-Worth Foundation for Women & Girls Scholar Prize! 💚💚💚#educationreimagined

The High School officially has our very own Black Box Theatre!! 🎭

🎉 It has been outfitted with black curtains that surround the space allowing for the white boards to be used if necessary, but also covering them and the large windows, providing a black box studio space.

💡 A portable light grid has been erected and new LED stage lights fully cover the space and are controlled by a light board. A Marley floor has also been provided to be rolled out for yoga, floor work and dance.

💃 The possibilities for using this space are endless! The performance of solos, duet acting or small group scenework, or one acts with less than 8 people cast. As a lecture room for a guest speaker it could seat 40-50 people. The lights can be gelled with color and focused in a variety of patterns, allowing to teach light design as well as teach actors to feel and move in their light.

🎶 The current use is daily classes in movement and theatre as well as rehearsal space for all other shows, including the musical!

post_text: A few weeks ago our incredible BHHS Students were selected to perform in the Disney Arts Showcase! The Disney Community Arts Showcase invites school performing groups to send in an audition video and application. They select and invite only a small percentage to come perform and enjoy a day in the Theme Park, free of charge. The BHHS Orchestra has been awarded this privilege many years in a row. The BHHS Orchestra, comprised of musicians from the symphonic band and chamber orchestra classes rehearsed during lunches and after school to prepare for this event, allowing all these fine musicians the opportunity to play and perform full symphony orchestra repertoire. This combined group will also perform at the end of April. 🎶 🎻 🎼

post_text: At the Board of Education meeting yesterday, 1/28/2020, the Board of Education unanimously voted to approve, pass and adopt Resolution NO. 2019-2020-011 to oversee a multi-faceted educational campaign to eliminate student vaping at BHHS and BVMS. This Resolution is in addition to existing anti-vaping programs, forthcoming anti-vaping initiatives and an extremely successful anti-vaping week (last week) at BVMS which resulted in hundreds of students signing a vape free pledge. We take vaping very seriously and will update you in the coming weeks with specific educational campaign elements to be rolled out throughout the District. Please see the full Resolution in this photo or visit bhusd.org/vapingresolution/ 🚭❌🌬

post_text: Talk about incredible opportunities!! On Friday morning, the BVMS band, percussion ensemble, orchestra and choir students loaded onto buses (provided by BV PTA) to attend Disney Performing Arts Workshops. Under the direction of a Disney clinician, the students learned about the process of recording a movie soundtrack. This activity emphasized the importance of sight-reading as students recorded instrumental and vocal music in a simulated film-scoring studio environment. Each workshop culminated with a screening of the students' recorded work set to Disney film footage. After the workshops, the students spent a fun-filled day at Disneyland Park! We love our Middle School @bvmsbulldogs 💚 @disney
